 How Sci-fi Doesn't Work 
Have you
ever watched a science fiction movie and thought that the futuristic space
battle or intergalactic travel that you're seeing is probably impossible? While
many of these beloved movies base their fictions on real science, frequently
mistakes and false assumptions are made. In this article, find out how sci-fi
doesn't work as we break down some of the major misconceptions about many
sci-fi classics.
Also at HowStuffWorks
 


How
Hydropower Plants Work - Worldwide,
hydropower plants produce about 24 percent of the world's electricity and
supply more than 1 billion people with power. More than 2,000 of these plants
operate in the United States,
making them the country's largest renewable energy source. Learn how hydropower
plants harness the power of water to make energy.
 


How
Vampires Work - People
have been dreaming up horrible monsters and malicious spirits for centuries.
Vampire-like creatures have appeared in dozens of cultures for thousands of
years. In this article, learn where the vampire legend came from, find out about
the scientific basis for vampires, and discover some real-life counterparts to
the supernatural vampire.
  
How Light Emitting Diodes Work  - Apple just released its new MacBook Pro laptops featuring LED screens. But what are the advantages of an LED screen and how does it work? Find out how light emitting diodes work and learn about their benefits.

How
Acoustic Levitation Works - Acoustic
levitation uses sound waves to suspend objects in a fluid, like air. This
process works because of an effect called "wave reflection." Check out this
video from HowStuffWorks to see acoustic levitation in action.
